seo_title: European Stocks Up, France Flat; Eurozone PMI at 17-Month...
seo_description: European equities mostly rose today, led by Stoxx 600, FTSE 100, and DAX, while France's CAC 40 remained flat. Eurozone PMI hit a 17-month high, boosting sen...
tldr: The pan-European Stoxx Europe 600 index closed 0.23% higher, with major markets like the UK's FTSE 100, Germany's DAX 40, and Italy's FTSE MIB 30 also recording gains.
France's CAC 40 index remained unchanged, contrasting with the broader upward trend across European bourses.
Economic indicators bolstered sentiment, as the Eurozone Composite PMI reached a 17-month high of 52.2 in October, and UK retail sales in September surpassed expectations with a 0.5% increase.
content_md:
**European Equities Mostly Up; France's CAC 40 Flat as Key Economic Data Boosts Sentiment**

European stock markets largely closed higher today, driven by positive economic data, although France's CAC 40 bucked the trend by remaining flat.

The pan-European Stoxx Europe 600 benchmark index ended the day up 0.23% at 575.76 points. Among the major national indices, the UK's FTSE 100 gained 0.7% to close at 9,645.62 points. Germany's DAX 40 index rose 0.13% to 24,239.89 points, and Italy's FTSE MIB 30 index saw a 0.25% increase, finishing at 42,486.67 points. In contrast, France's CAC 40 index remained unchanged, closing at 8,225.63 points.

Currency markets also saw movement, with the Euro/Dollar parity trading at 1.162 as of 19:25 Turkish time, marking a 0.05% rise.

The positive market sentiment was partly underpinned by encouraging economic indicators. The Eurozone's Composite Purchasing Managers' Index (PMI) increased from 51.2 in September to 52.2 in October, reaching its highest level in 17 months. Separately, retail sales in the United Kingdom grew by 0.5% in September, surpassing market expectations.
